Overview#

Our tutorials are organized into three progressive levels:

üå± Beginner: Start here if you‚Äôre new to quantum computing üåø Intermediate: Ready for variational algorithms and chemistry üå≤ Advanced: Cutting-edge techniques and research applications

Learning Path#

Recommended progression:

  1. Start with Beginner ‚Üí Learn quantum basics, gates, and circuits

  2. Move to Intermediate ‚Üí Master VQE, optimization, and quantum chemistry

  3. Advance to Expert ‚Üí Explore hybrid algorithms and quantum ML

Time Investment: - Beginner: 2-4 hours - Intermediate: 4-6 hours - Advanced: 6-8 hours

What You‚Äôll Learn#

Beginner Tutorial#

‚úÖ Installation & Setup: Get TyxonQ running ‚úÖ First Quantum Circuit: Bell states and entanglement ‚úÖ Basic Gates: X, H, CNOT operations ‚úÖ Multi-Qubit Systems: GHZ states and scaling ‚úÖ Simulators: Choosing the right backend ‚úÖ Practical Exercises: Hands-on practice

Perfect for: Complete beginners, students, educators

Intermediate Tutorial#

‚úÖ Variational Algorithms: VQE from scratch ‚úÖ Quantum Chemistry: H‚ÇÇ and molecular calculations ‚úÖ Optimization Techniques: Gradients and methods ‚úÖ Algorithm Comparison: UCCSD vs HEA vs PUCCD ‚úÖ Custom Implementation: Build your own VQE ‚úÖ Real Projects: Practical applications

Perfect for: Those with basic quantum knowledge, chemistry researchers

Advanced Tutorial#

‚úÖ Hybrid Quantum-Classical: Neural networks with quantum layers ‚úÖ Quantum Machine Learning: Kernels, SVM, generative models ‚úÖ Advanced VQE: Adaptive ansatz construction ‚úÖ Error Correction: Basic quantum error correction codes ‚úÖ Research Applications: Cutting-edge techniques ‚úÖ Performance Optimization: Efficient implementations

Perfect for: Researchers, advanced practitioners, algorithm developers
